div.div: Process of initial full model construction.
div.p: Variables included: Year (Yr), Month, hours fished (HRSF), number of fisherman (NFMEN), first and second axis of Principal Coordinate Analysis based on species abundance (PCO1 and PCO2) and presence (PCO1.2 and PCO2.2), fishing area (Area, see Fig 1), wet or dry season (Season) and weather bonefish was target or not (Target). NA resulted for models that did not converged. The final selected models where identified using a backward selection process (See S2 and S3 Tables for details) and illustrated below each table.
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Model selection process to simplify the initial full CATCH model.
div.p: Variables included: Year (Yr), Month, hours fished (HRSF), number of fisherman (NFMEN), first and second axis of Principal Coordinate Analysis based on species abundance (PCO1 and PCO2) and presence (PCO1.2 and PCO2.2). Asterisks are illustrating the variables that were included in each candidate model. We selected the model with the minimum AIC (i.e., equal to 0 delta AIC) as the final model for subsequent analyses (highlighted row).
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Model selection process to simplify the initial full PTRIPS model.
div.p: Variables included: Year (Yr), Month, hours fished (HRSF), number of fisherman (NFMEN), first and second axis of Principal Coordinate Analysis based on species abundance (PCO1 and PCO2) and presence (PCO1.2 and PCO2.2). Asterisks are illustrating the variables that were included in each candidate model. We selected the model with the minimum AIC (i.e., equal to 0 delta AIC) as the final model for subsequent analyses (highlighted row).
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Process to simplify the initial CATCH mixed model (CATCH 1 + random(Season)).
div.p: This process was performed after identifying the mixed model as the most fitted model structure for CATCH. Variables included: Year (Yr), Month, hours fished (HRSF), number of fisherman (NFMEN), first and second axis of Principal Coordinate Analysis based on species abundance (PCO1 and PCO2) and presence (PCO1.2 and PCO2.2). Asterisks are illustrating the variables that were included in each candidate model. We selected the model with the minimum AIC (i.e., equal to 0 delta AIC) as the final model for assess the temporal trend in bonefish catch (highlighted row).
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Index of catch and proportion of positive trips obtained from GAM models (i.e. fitted values: CATCH.mean.fit and PTRPS.mean.fit), and nominal catch and proportion of positive trips (i.e., raw means) from 1980 to 2014.
div.p: The 95% confidence intervals (Upper- and Lower Bound) and standard errors (SE) of the fitted values are also listed for each model (CATCH and PTRIPS).
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Mean species richness associated with bonefish catch from 1980 to 2014.
div.p: Also listed the number of observations (N), the minimum and maximum species richness (Min and Max species richness) and the standard error of the mean values.
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Proportion of positive trips when targeted from 1980 to 2014.
div.p: The proportion consisted of the total number of trips that caught bonefish when targeted (Total of positive trips) divided by the total of trips that reported bonefish as the main targeted species (Total of targeted trips).
(DOCX)
Click here for additional data file.
